intro: Callichlamys peckoltii, commonly known as the Peckoltii callichlamys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
